channel.description: Recent content in Lent on Jeff Benson's Blog

item.title: Day 30: Happy Saturday
item.description: Today has been a Saturday much like most Saturdays, which is to say not much occurred today.

item.title: Day 28: Hard Times
item.description: Today has been a bit of a challenge. Apart from being pulled in seemingly every conceivable direction at work, I had to have several hard conversations today.

item.title: Day 27: Large Boxes
item.description: As I am writing this post, I am reminded that I am very sore as a result of today.

item.title: Day 26: What I Know
item.description: There’s a lot I don’t know today. I don’t know exactly when the sun will rise.

item.title: Day 25: Great Timing
item.description: Earlier today while on a group call, one of my friends remarked how amazing it was that we would all live in such a time as this to be able to have group voice calls (with video even), and how radically that has changed the way that people are coping with the current pandemic.

item.title: Day 23: Stay at Home
item.description: So in part because the current advice is to stay at home when possible and in part because I felt I needed a break, today was Stay at Home Saturdays ™ with Jeff Benson.

item.title: Day 22: Family
item.description: Today a dear friend of mine and his fianc√© announced they would be pushing their wedding up considerably due to concerns about a total lockdown.

item.title: Day 21: The Trail
item.description: So today I guess it technically the halfway point of this whole journey, and coincidentally enough today is also the first day of spring.

item.title: Day 20: Mr. Rogers
item.description: He was despised and rejected by men, a man of sorrows and acquainted with grief; Isaiah 53:3a (English Standard Version)

item.title: Day 19: Wasabi Peas
item.description: Yesterday I had to swing by the grocery store, since I was out of almond milk.

item.title: Day 18: Isolation
item.description: One of the common practices that’s been going around the news is that of self-isolation.

item.title: Day 16: Blended Malt Whiskey
item.description: Today was a good day to be partially Irish as well as Scottish.

item.title: Day 15: Anxiety
item.description: Before I go any further, let me just say this is not another hot take on the potential outcomes of the current COVID-19 pandemic.

item.title: Day 15: Birthday
item.description: If the title wasn’t obvious enough, today is my birthday, and I am officially the ripe old age of 27 years.

item.title: Day 14: Ligher Side
item.description: These past few days (or rather, since the start of this blog) there have been a lot of serious discussions.

item.title: Day 13: Emotional Intelligence
item.description: I think for me some of the hardest topics to discuss involve emotions.

item.title: Day 11: Creativity
item.description: Once again, I believe I should have wrote yesterday, but it was already late when I had the opportunity to sit down, and I don’t believe we’re practicing that kind of suffering this Lent.

item.title: Day 9: Patience
item.description: I think for me this year one of the hardest lessons I’m learning is patience.

item.title: Day 8: Seeking Rest
item.description: So I’m still sick today, which means as I’m writing this at the close of my day I am seriously looking forward to my bed.

item.title: Day 7: Being Sick
item.description: So if the title wasn’t obvious, I fear that I may be coming down with some sort of illness impacting my head, throat, and sinuses.

item.title: Day 6: Consistency
item.description: I’m never really sure how to count Sundays in Lent.

item.title: Day 4: Celebration
item.description: So yes I didn’t post yesterday, which though normally my reaction would be like:

item.title: Day 2: On Brokenness
item.description: Maybe you and I were never meant to be complete

item.title: Day 1: Slamming Into Lent
item.description: So today marks the opening day of a series I want to write about for Lent.
